intro: Hesperis isatidea, commonly known as the sweet William or the garden helen. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The plant is native to Europe and has been widely introduced to other regions for ornamental purposes.
